SourceText: True or False: Parents should wait until their children are school-aged before talking about risks of sexual abuse.

text: üå∑ Akusoze kubekwamsinya ukuthetha nomntwana wakho malunga nokumgcina ekhuselekile ekuxhatshazweni ngokwesondo.

SourceText: üß∏ Even young children can learn about which parts of their body are private and which parts are public.
text: üß∏ Kwanabo abantwana abancinci bangafunda malunga nokuba ngawaphi amalungu omzimba angasese kwaye ngawaphi amalungu aseluntwini.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} wants to help his young children learn about safe and unsafe touch. Let‚Äôs see how he has the conversation with his young son, {F1_SON_5}.
text: U{F1_FATHER} ufuna ukunceda abantwana bakhe abancinci bafunde ngokhuseleko kunye nokuphathwa okungakhuselekanga. Masikhe sibone ukuba uncokola njani nonyana wakhe omncinci, u{F1_SON_5}.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: Did you enjoy the story, {F1_SON_5}?
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Ingaba ulonwabele ibali, {F1_SON_5}?

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: Yes, {F1_FATHER}! It was fun!
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Ewe, {F1_FATHER}! Belimnandi!

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**:  Now, there are some important things I want to talk to you about. It's about keeping your body safe and healthy.
text: **{F1_FATHER}**:  Ngoku, kukho izinto ezibalulekileyo endifuna ukuthetha ngazo nawe. Imalunga nokugcina umzimba wakho ukhuselekile kwaye usempilweni.

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: What do you mean, {F1_FATHER}?
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Uthetha ukuthini, {F1_FATHER}?

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: First, we all have private parts on our bodies. These are the parts that are covered by our underwear.
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Okokuqala, sonke sinawo amalungu angasese emizimbeni yethu. Lamalungu ngala agqunywa yimpahla yangaphantsi.

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: Like this?
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Ngolu hlobo?

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: Exactly. It's important to remember that these parts are private, and no one should touch them except to keep you clean and healthy.
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Kanye. Kubalulekile ukukhumbula ukuba la ngamalungu angasese, kwaye akukhomntu ofanele ukuwaphatha ngaphandle kokuba uyacocwa ukuze uhlale usempilweni.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say "no" if someone wants to touch you in a way that feels uncomfortable or wrong.
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Umzimba wakho ngowakho, kwaye unelungelo lokuthi 'hayi' ukuba omnye umntu ufuna ukukuphatha ngendlela ekwenza uzive ungakhululekanga okanye engalunganga.

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: Okay, {F1_FATHER}.
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Kulungile, {F1_FATHER}.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: And if anything ever happens that makes you feel scared or uneasy, remember you can always come and tell me or {F1_MOTHER}. We're here to protect you and keep you safe.
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Kwaye ukuba nantoni na ethi yenzeke kuwe ikwenza uzive usoyika okanye ungakhululeki, khumbula ungasoloko usiza kum undixelele okanye {F1_MOTHER}. Silapha ukuzokhusela wena kunye nokugcina ukhuselekile.

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: I will tell you and {F1_MOTHER}, {F1_FATHER}.
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Ndizakuxelela wena kunye {F1_MOTHER}, {F1_FATHER}.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: We love you, **{F1_SON_5}. Now, let's give each other a big hug!
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Siyakuthanda, {F1_SON_5}. Ngoku, Masiwolaneni kakhulu!

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**:  Now, there are some important things I want to talk to you about. It's about keeping your body safe and healthy.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**:  Ngoku, kukho izinto ezibalulekileyo endifuna ukuthetha ngazo nawe. Imalunga nokugcina umzimba wakho ukhuselekile kwaye usempilweni.

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: What do you mean, {F2_GRANDMOTHER}?
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Uthetha ukuthini, {F2_GRANDMOTHER}?

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: First, we all have private parts on our bodies. These are the parts that are covered by our underwear.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Okokuqala, sonke sinawo amalungu angasese emizimbeni yethu. Lamalungu ngala agqunywa yimpahla yangaphantsi.

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Like this?
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Ngolu hlobo?

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Exactly. It's important to remember that these parts are private, and no one should touch them except to keep you clean and healthy.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Kanye. Kubalulekile ukukhumbula ukuba la ngamalungu angasese, kwaye akukhomntu ofanele ukuwaphatha ngaphandle kokuba uyacocwa ukuze uhlale usempilweni.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say "no" if someone wants to touch you in a way that feels uncomfortable or wrong.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Umzimba wakho ngowakho, kwaye unelungelo lokuthi 'hayi' ukuba omnye umntu ufuna ukukuphatha ngendlela ekwenza uzive ungakhululekanga okanye engalunganga.

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Okay, {F2_GRANDMOTHER}.
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Kulungile, {F2_GRANDMOTHER}.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: And if anything ever happens that makes you feel scared or uneasy, remember you can always come and tell me or your teacher. We are here to protect you and keep you safe.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Kwaye ukuba nantoni na ethi yenzeke kuwe ekwenza uzive usoyika okanye ungakhululekanga, khumbula ungasoloko usiza kum undixelele okanye utitshala wakho. Silapha ukuzokhusela wena kunye nokukugcina ukhuselekile.

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: I will tell you, {F2_GRANDMOTHER}.
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Ndizakuxelela, {F2_GRANDMOTHER}.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: I love you, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Now, let's give each other a big hug!
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Ndiyakuthanda, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Ngoku, masiwolane kakhulu!

SourceText: ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π  You are not alone. Call Childline on 116 ‚Äî a caring counsellor is ready to listen, support, and help you find a way through tough situations. Teach your child to dial 116 if they or someone they know needs extra help and support.
text: ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©πAwukho wedwa. Fonela i Childline kwi 116 - ikhansela enobubele ikulungele ukumamela, ukuxhasa, kwaye nokunceda wena ufumane indlela yokuphumela kwiimeko ezinzima. Fundisa umntwana wakho ukufonela u 116 ukuba bona okanye umntu abamaziyo edinga unceda kunye nenkxaso eyongezelelweyo.

SourceText: üòî It is normal to feel uncomfortable about talking to children about abuse.
text: üòî Kuqhelekile ukuziva ungakhululekanga ukuthetha nabantwana malunga nokuxhatshazwa.

SourceText: üí° But there are some simple things that can help them understand when it is not OK to be touched, and what they should do if something ever happens.
text: üí° Kodwa zikhona izinto ezilula ezinokubanceda baqonde xa KUNGALUNGANGA ukuphathwa, kwaye kufuneka benze ntoni ukuba kukho into ethe yenzeka.

SourceText: Here‚Äôs a story about a time {F3_DAUGHTER_7} felt unsafe about someone touching her.
text: Nali ibali elingexesha apho u{F3_DAUGHTER_7} wayeziva engakhuselekanga malunga nomntu omphathayo.

SourceText: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: (Tearing up) {F3_MOTHER}, Uncle gives very long hugs! I don‚Äôt like them.
text: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: (Echiphiza inyembezi) {F3_MOTHER}, Umalume undiwola ixesha elide! Andithandi.

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: Oh dear, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}, that is not OK. Thank you for telling me about it.
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: Owu sithandwa, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}, oko AKULUNGANGA. Enkosi ngokundixelela malunga ngalomba.

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: If he ever tries to give you a hug again, you can tell him, ‚ÄúNo, let‚Äôs rather shake hands,‚Äù and tell me straight away. Shall we practise?
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: Ukuba ukhe wazama ukukuwola futhi, ungamxelela, ‚ÄúHayi, kungcono sixhawulane izandla,‚Äù kwaye undixelele kwangoko. Singaziqhelanisa noku?

SourceText: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: (Practising) No, let‚Äôs rather shake hands, please.
text: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: (Ukuziqhelanisa) Hayi, kungcono sixhawulane izandla, ndiyacela.

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: Well done, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}. I love you very much and I‚Äôm so glad you spoke to me about it. If Uncle makes you feel uncomfortable again, you must tell me immediately. You should always feel safe and comfortable with the people around you.
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: Wenze kakuhle, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}. Ndiyakuthanda kakhulu kwaye ndiyavuya uthethile nam malunga nayo. Ukuba uMalume ukwenza uzive ungakhululekanga kwakhona, uzundixelele ngokukhawuleza. Kufuneka uzive ukhuselekile kwaye ukhululekile ngalo lonke ixesha xa unabantu abakungqongileyo.

SourceText: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: Thank you, {F3_MOTHER}. I‚Äôm glad I can tell you about these things.
text: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: Enkosi, {F3_MOTHER}. Ndiyavuya ukuba ndingakuxelela ngezi zinto.

SourceText: Let‚Äôs check in on {F2_DAUGHTER_3} and her grandfather, who are playing together outside:
text: Makhe sijongeni ku{F2_DAUGHTER_3} kunye no tamkhulu wakhe, abazidlalela phandle kunye:

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Look {F2_GRANDFATHER}, how far I can kick my ball!
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Jonga {F2_GRANDFATHER}, ndiyikhabela kude kangakanani ibhola yam!

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Oh no! My ball!
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Owu hayi! Ibhola yam!

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Remember what we talked about, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. What should we do if the ball goes on the street?
text: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Khumbula ukuba besithethe ngantoni, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Kufuneka senze ntoni ukuba ibhola iya esitalatweni?

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: We should stay where we are and ask an adult for help.
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: Kufuneka sihlala kulendawo sikuyo kwaye sicele umntu omdala asincede.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: That‚Äôs right! I am so proud of you for remembering. Roads are for cars and bikes, and it is safer for an adult to get your ball for you.
text: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Oko kulungile! Ndiyazingca ngawe ngokukhumbula. Imigaqo yeyemoto kunye nezithuthuthu, kwaye kukhuselekile ukuba umntu omdala ayokuthathela ibhola yakho.

SourceText: Let‚Äôs check in on {F2_SON_8} and his grandmother after {F2_SON_8} finds himself in an uncomfortable situation:
text: Makhe sijongeni ku{F2_SON_8} kunye nomakhulu wakhe emvakokuba u{F2_SON_8} ezifumana ekwimeko engamkhululekisiyo:

SourceText: **{F2_SON_8}**: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}, I was playing in the garden. Something happened!!
text: **{F2_SON_8}**: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}, Bendidlala egadini. Kukho into eyenzekileyo!!

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: What is it, {F2_SON_8}!? Take a breath and tell me.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Yintoni, {F2_SON_8}!? Phefumla kwaye undixelele.

SourceText: **{MAN_IN_CAR}**: Hi boy. You are so good at kicking that ball and you look so strong! I wish I could kick a ball like you. What‚Äôs your name?
text: **{MAN_IN_CAR}**: Molo nkwenkwe. Uyikhaba kakuhle ibhola kwaye ubonakala womelele! Ndinqwenela ukuba ndingakhaba ibhola njengawe. Ungubani igama lakho?

SourceText: **{F2_SON_8}**: My name is {F2_SON_8}.
text: **{F2_SON_8}**: Igama lam ndingu{F2_SON_8}.

SourceText: **{MAN_IN_CAR}**: {F2_SON_8}, such a beautiful name.
text: **{MAN_IN_CAR}**: {F2_SON_8}, lihle igama lakho.

SourceText: **{F2_SON_8}**: Thank you.
text: **{F2_SON_8}**: Enkosi.

SourceText: **{MAN_IN_CAR}**: {F2_SON_8}, I have chips and some toys for you in my car. If you come in, you can eat chips and play with all the toys, I promise‚Ä¶
text: **{MAN_IN_CAR}**: {F2_SON_8}, Ndineetshipsi kunye neethoyi zakho emotweni yam. Ukuba uyangena, ungazitya iitshipsi kwaye udlale ngeethoyi, Ndiyakuthembisa‚Ä¶

SourceText: **{F2_SON_8}**: No, thank you.
text: **{F2_SON_8}**: Hayi, enkosi.

SourceText: **{F2_SON_8}**: Graaannnnyyyyyy!!
text: **{F2_SON_8}**: Makhuuuuulu!!

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: {F2_SON_8}, I‚Äôm so proud of you for not getting out of our yard and getting into the car. You remembered the rules we created about safety in this community. That was a dangerous situation. You are so brave. Thank you for telling me. I will report it so it doesn‚Äôt happen again.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: {F2_SON_8}, Ndiyazingca ngawe ngokungaphumi ngapha kweyadi kunye nokungangeni emotweni. Uyikhumbulile imithetho ebesiyenzile malunga nokukhuseleka apha ekuhlaleni. Leyana ibiyimeko enobungozi. Unesibindi. Enkosi ngokundixelela. Ndizakuyichaza ukuze ingaphinde yenzeke kwakhona.

SourceText: This lesson is about learning how to respond when our children are in crisis.‚ùó
text: Esi sifundo simalunga nokufunda ukuba sisabela kanjani xa abantwana bethu besengxakini.‚ùó

SourceText: When our children share something that is very hard or upsetting to themüòîüò£, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open, so that they feel supported. üíõ
text: Xa abantwana bethu besabelana ngento enzima kakhulu okanye ebakhathazayoüòîüò£, kufuneka sikhumbule ukuhlala sizolile, simamele, kwaye sivuleleke ukuze bazive bexhaswa. üíõ

SourceText: True or False: When my child is upset, I should wait for them to come to me. I don‚Äôt want to upset them further by asking what is troubling them.
text: Yinyani okanye Ayonyani: Xa umntwana wam ekhathazekile, kufuneka ndimlinde aze kum. Andifuni ukumcaphukisa nangakumbi ngokumbuza yintoni emhluphayo.

SourceText: üò£ When children are in crisis, they may be scared to tell others about it for many reasons. They may be worried about others judging them or getting angry. They may also feel shame.
text: üò£ Xa abantwana besengxakini, bangoyika ukuxelela abanye malunga noku ngenxa yezizathu ezininzi. Bangakhathazwa kukuba abanye bazakubagweba okanye babacaphukise. Bangaziva benazo neentloni.

SourceText: üíö You can ask your child very calmly about why they seem upset. üëÄ
text: üíö Ungambuza umntwana wakho ngokuzolileyo malunga nokuba kutheni ebonakala ekhathazekile. üëÄ

SourceText: üëÇ Assure them that you are proud of how brave they are to share their crisis with you.
text: üëÇ Mqinisekise ukuba uyazingca ngendlela abenesibindi ngayo ngokwabelana ingxaki yakhe nawe.

SourceText: üå∑ That‚Äôs right!
text: üå∑ Oku kulungile!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} looks upset. Let‚Äôs see how his father responds:
text: U{F1_SON_5} Ubonakala ekhathazekile. Masikhe sibone utata wakhe, uphendula njani:

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: I don't want to play with Daniel today.
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Andifuni ukudlala no Daniel namhlanje.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: What happened, {F1_SON_5}? I thought you and Daniel were friends. Do you want to talk about it?
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Kwenzeke ntoni, {F1_SON_5}? Bendicinga wena kunye no Daniel ningabahlobo. Uyafuna ukuthetha ngayo?

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}** (crying): He and some of the other kids were mean to me. They said I was stupid because I can‚Äôt button my shirt properly.
text: **{F1_SON_5}** (elila): Yena kunye nabanye abantwana bebekrwada kum. Bathe ndisisidenge ngenxa yokuba ndingakwazi ukuqhobosha ihempe yam kakuhle.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}** : Oh my {F1_SON_5}, that is not a very nice thing to say to someone. I can understand why you would feel upset about this.
text: **{F1_FATHER}** : Owu {F1_SON_5}, ayiyonto intle leyo ukuyithetha emntwini. Ndiyasiqonda isizathu sokuba ungaziva ukhathazekile ngale nto.

SourceText: First of all, you are not stupid! I am so proud of how much you are growing and learning. It is important that Daniel and the others know that it is not okay to say mean things. Would you like me to come with you so that we can have a chat with the others together?
text: Okokuqala, awusiso isidenge! Ndiyazingca ngendlela okhula ngayo kwaye nofunda ngayo. Kubalulekile ukuba uDaniel kunye nabanye bayazi ukuba akulunganga ukutsho izinto ezimbi. Ungathanda ukuba ndihambe nawe ukuze sincokole nabanye sisonke?

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: Okay‚Ä¶
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: Kulungile‚Ä¶

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: I can also have a chat with Daniel's parents to let them know. Daniel is a good boy and is usually nice to you so maybe there is something else happening.
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Ndingakwazi nokuncokola nabazali bakaDaniel ndibazise. U Daniel yinkwenkwe elungileyo kwaye uhlala enobubele kuwe mhlawumbi kukho enye into eyenzekayo.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing with me, {F1_SON_5}. I am very proud of you.
text: Enkosi ngokwabelana nam, {F1_SON_5}. Ndiyazingca kakhulu ngawe.

SourceText: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Press play to learn the 4Ô∏è‚É£ four things you can do to support your child when they share something difficult with you.
text: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Cofa dlala ukuze ufunde 4Ô∏è‚É£izinto ezine onokuzenza ukuze uxhase umntwana wakho xa esabelana nawe ngento enzima.

SourceText: 4Ô∏è‚É£ Here are four things you can do to support your child when they share something difficult with you:
text: Nazi izinto ezine onokuzenza ukuze uxhase umntwana wakho xa esabelana nawe ngento enzima:

SourceText: 1Ô∏è‚É£ BREATHE: Take a pause
text: 1Ô∏è‚É£ PHEFUMLA: Thatha umzuzu

SourceText: üå± Take a deep breath so you can respond calmly.
text: üå± Thatha umoya onzulu ukuze ukwazi ukuphendula ngokuzolileyo.

SourceText: üíõ Ask yourself, ‚ÄúWhat does my child need right now?‚Äù
text: Zibuze, "Umntwana wam udinga ntoni ngoku?"

SourceText: 2Ô∏è‚É£ LISTEN: Ask your child what is going on
text: 2Ô∏è‚É£ MAMELA: Buza umntwana wakho ukuba kuqhubeka ntoni

SourceText: üëÇ Let your child share with you what they need. Sometimes, it may be easier for your child to draw what happened instead of explaining it.
text: üëÇ Mvumele umntwana wakho abelane nawe ngakudingayo. Ngamanye amaxesha kungabonakala kulula kumntwana wakho ukuzoba okwenzekileyo kunokuyicacisa.

SourceText: üîÑIn these moments, maintaining a consistent routine can be particularly helpful. Familiar routines can provide a sense of security and normalcy, helping your child feel safe again.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_7} is in trouble. Let‚Äôs see how her mother responds:
text: U{F3_DAUGHTER_7} usengxakini. Masikhe sibone umakhulu wakhe umphendula kanjani:

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: My dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: Sithandwa sam, ubonakala ukhathazekile nyhani, uyafuna ukundibalisela ukuba kwenzeke ntoni?

SourceText: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: It‚Äôs my uncle, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ he touched me.
text: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: Ngumalume wam, u... u... uye wandiphatha.

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}** (thinking): Take a deep breath... What does my child need? She needs me to be calm and listen.
text: **{F3_MOTHER}** (uyacinga): Phefumla... Udinga ntoni umntwana wam? Ufuna ndizole kwaye ndimamele.

SourceText: Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, I‚Äôm listening.
text: Yiza uzokuhlala phantsi ecaleni kwam. Thatha ixesha lakho, ndimamele.

SourceText: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: It‚Äôs true, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ made me very uncomfortable‚Ä¶ he touched my body and told me I‚Äôd be in trouble if I told anybody! I didn‚Äôt want to do anything with him, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.
text: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: Yinyaniso, u‚Ä¶ u‚Ä¶ ndenze ndangakhululeki kakhulu‚Ä¶ uphathe umzimba wam kwaye wandixelela ukuba ndizakuba sengxakini ukuba ndithe ndaxelela nabani na! Bendingafuni ukwenza nantoni na naye, kwaye nditshilo nokuba HAYI, kodwa undixelele ukuba ndizakubasengxakini.

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: You are so brave for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault. Thank you for telling me.
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: Unesibindi ngokwabelana nam ngalento. Awukho sengxakini. Ayilotyala lakho eli. Enkosi ngokundixelela.

SourceText: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: Yesterday, when you went to see your friend, he just came here and that‚Äôs when it happened.
text: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: Izolo, ngokuya ubuyokubona umhlobo wakho, uvele wafika apha kwaye kungelaxesha yenzeke ngalo.

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: It‚Äôs okay, I believe you, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}. You have done the right thing telling me. What happened is not OK, but I am here for you to help you and support you.
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: Kulungile, ndiyakukholelwa, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}. Wenze into elungileyo ngokundixelela. Le nto yenzekileyo AYILUNGANGA, kodwa ndilapha ukuze ndikuncede kwaye ndikuxhase.

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: We will need to talk to someone who will help keep you safe. Would that be okay, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}? I will be with you the whole time.
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: Kuzofuneka sithethe nomntu ozakunceda akugcine ukhuselekile. Ingalunga lonto, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}? Ndizakuba nawe ngalo lonke ixesha.

SourceText: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: Yes‚Ä¶ Okay‚Ä¶ where will we go?
text: **{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: Ewe‚Ä¶ Kulungile‚Ä¶ sizakuyaphi?

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: We can go to the clinic. And {F3_DAUGHTER_7} remember this is not your fault. I love you. We will get through this.
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: Singaya eklinikhi. Kwaye {F3_DAUGHTER_7} khumbula lento ayilo tyala lakho. Ndiyakuthanda. Sizakudlula kulento.

SourceText: {F2_SON_8} wants to play games on the phone. His grandfather uses this opportunity to teach {F2_SON_8} about how to stay safe online:
text: U{F2_SON_8} ufuna ukudlala imidlalo efowunini. Utat'omkhulu wakhe usebenzisa eli thuba ukufundisa u{F2_SON_8} malunga nokuhlala ukhuselekile kwi-intanethi:

SourceText: **{F2_SON_8}**: Can I use the phone to play games?
text: **{F2_SON_8}**: Ndingasebenzisa ifowuni ukudlala imidlalo?

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Sure! But let‚Äôs first learn how to be safe when using phones or tablets. First, the household rule is that you can only use the phone or tablet for 30 minutes each day. It is the length of one episode of your favourite cartoon. I will set a timer that will go off when you have 5 minutes left.
text: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Ngokuqinisekileyo! Kodwa masiqale sifunde indlela yokhuseleka xa usebenzisa iifowuni okanye iithabhulethi. Okokuqala, umthetho kukuba ungasebenzisa ifowuni okanye ithabhulethi imizuzu eyi 30 kuphela ngosuku. Bubude besiqendu esinye sikapopayi owuthandayo. Ndizakuseta isibali-xesha esiza kucima xa unemizuzu eyi 5 eshiyekileyo.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Always ask me or {F2_GRANDMOTHER} for permission before using any device or downloading any app. You should also only play games or watch videos that we have approved, okay?
text: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Ndicele ngawo onke amaxesha okanye u{F2_GRANDMOTHER} imvume ngaphambi kokusebenzisa nasiphi na isixhobo okanye ukhuphela nayiphi na i-app. Kufuneka udlale imidlalo kuphela okanye ubukele iividiyo esizivumileyo, siyevana?

SourceText: **{F2_SON_8}**: Okay, {F2_GRANDFATHER}!
text: **{F2_SON_8}**: Kulungile, {F2_GRANDFATHER}!

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: You are a great listener!
text: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Ungumphulaphuli obalaseleyo!

SourceText: **{F2_SON_8}**: Can I create my own account for pictures and videos, Grandpa? {F2_DAUGHTER_17} has an account for herself.
text: **{F2_SON_8}**: Ndingazenzela eyam i-akhawunti yemifanekiso kunye neevidiyo, Tamkhulu? u{F2_DAUGHTER_17} une-akhawunti yakhe.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: We'll wait until you're a bit older, {F2_SON_8}. Social media is for older kids. What we can do is post pictures on my account together if you want.
text: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Sizokulinda ude ube mdala, {F2_SON_8}. Amakhasi onxibelelwano ngawabantwana abadala. Into esinokuyenza kukuthumela imifanekiso kwi-akhawunti yam kunye ukuba uyafuna.

SourceText: **{F2_SON_8}**: Okay.
text: **{F2_SON_8}**: Kulungile.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Thank you for understanding. And remember, never click on a pop-up or picture if it appears. Also, if anything ever upsets you, let us know right away. We're here to keep you safe! Let‚Äôs play for 5 minutes to practise what we agreed.
text: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: Enkosi ngokuqonda. Kwaye khumbula, ungaze ucofe kwi-pop-up okanye umfanekiso ukuba uyavela. Kwakhona, ukuba kukho into ekucaphukisayo, sazise ngoko nangoko. Silapha ukuze sikugcine ukhuselekile! Masidlale imizuzu emihlanu siziqhelanise noko besivumelene ngako.

SourceText: **{F2_SON_8}**: Yes, Grandpa! Thank you.
text: **{F2_SON_8}**: Ewe, Tamkhulu! Enkosi.

SourceText: ‚ùåüì± Plan phone-free times in your house, like during meals, homework, or in bed.

SourceText: üëÄ Before completing forms that ask for personal information, check that the web address begins with https://. Websites that begin with http:// may not be secure.

SourceText: üìù For older children, you can help them create strong passwords for their accounts. They should be long, not include obvious personal information like your name or birthday, and include upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols.
text: üìù Kubantwana abadala, ungabanceda benze amagama ayimfihlo aqinileyo kwii-akhawunti zabo. Kufuneka zibe nde, zingaquki iinkcukacha zobuqu ezicacileyo njengegama lakho okanye usuku lwakho lokuzalwa, kwaye ziquke oonobumba abakhulu nabancinci, amanani kunye neempawu.

text: Cofa Dlala ‚ñ∂Ô∏è ukuze ufunde 3Ô∏è‚É£ amanyathelo amathathu ukukunceda wenze imephu yokhuseleko kunye:

SourceText: It can be hard to think about dangerous situations for your teen.
text: Kunokuba nzima ukucinga ngeemeko eziyingozi kumntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: To keep our teens safe, we need to understand their reality and the potential risky situations they can find themselves in.
text: Ukugcina abantwana bethu abafikisayo bekhuselekile, kufuneka siqonde ubunyani babo kunye neemeko ezinomngcipheko abanokuthi bazifumane bakuzo.

SourceText: We can help our teens know how to use their thoughts and voices, in dangerous situations. It makes a big difference!
text: Sinokunceda abantwana bethu abafikisayo bazi indlela yokusebenzisa iingcinga kunye namazwi abo, kwiimeko ezinobungozi. Kwenza umahluko omkhulu!

SourceText: Check out these scenarios. What warning signs do you see?
text: Jonga ezi meko. Zeziphi iimpawu ezilumkisayo ozibonayo?

SourceText: **Boy**: Hey beautiful, why are you walking so fast! Don‚Äôt you want to come show us what is under that skirt?
text: **Mfana**: Haybo nzwakazi, kutheni uhamba ngokukhawuleza! Awufuni ukuza usibonise yintoni ephantsi kweso siketi?

SourceText: It‚Äôs okay to compliment and show attention, but it must be done respectfully.
text: Kulungile ukuncoma nokubonisa ingqalelo, kodwa kufuneka kwenziwe ngembeko.

SourceText: In this case, the boy‚Äôs friend should speak up and correct his friend‚Äôs behaviour.
text: Kule meko, umhlobo wenkwenkwe kufuneka athethe kwaye alungise ukuziphatha komhlobo wakhe.

SourceText: Let‚Äôs try another. What are the warning signs?
text: Masizameni enye. Zeziphi iimpawu ezilumkisayo?

SourceText: **{TEACHER_1}**: {F2_DAUGHTER_17}, if you want to get good grades this year, you need to stay after school when everyone is gone so I can tutor you.
text: **{TEACHER_1}**: {F2_DAUGHTER_17}, ukuba ufuna ukupasa kakuhle kulo nyaka, kufuneka uhlale ukuphuma kwesikolo xa wonke umntu emkile ukuze ndikufundise.

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: My friend also needs support. Can I invite her too?
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: Umhlobo wam naye ufuna inkxaso. Ndingammema naye?

SourceText: **{TEACHER_1}**: No, this will be our secret. You don‚Äôt want people to think you are stupid, right?
text: **{TEACHER_1}**: Hayi, izakuba yimfihlelo yethu le. Awufuni abantu bacinge ukuba usisidenge, akunjalo?

SourceText: üéâThat‚Äôs right.
text: üéâOku kulungile.

SourceText: Schools have strict rules to keep students safe. The teacher is abusing his power and knows it's wrong ‚ùå. He has likely done this before and might do it again üîÅ. {F2_DAUGHTER_17} could try to find others with the same experience üë• to make reporting him easier üó£Ô∏è.

Kusenokwenzeka ukuba uyenzile le nto ngaphambili kwaye unokuyiphinda ayenze kwakhona üîÅ. U{F2_DAUGHTER_17} unokuzama ukufumana abanye abanamava afanayo üë• ukwenzela ukumxela kube lula üó£Ô∏è.

SourceText: The correct answer was ‚ÄúThe teacher abuses his power and pressures the girl‚Äù.
text: Impendulo echanekileyo ibisithi ‚ÄúUtitshala ulisebenzisa kakubi igunya lakhe kwaye ucinezela intombazana‚Äù.

SourceText: In a dangerous situation, we might freeze ‚ùÑÔ∏è or get angry üò° ‚Äì that‚Äôs normal. These tools can help keep you and your teen safe: KNOW IT, SEE IT, SAY IT
text: Kwimeko enobungozi, sisenokuba ngumkhenkce ‚ùÑÔ∏è okanye sibe nomsindo üò° ‚Äì iqhelekile loo nto. Ezi zixhobo zinokukunceda ugcine wena kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo nikhuselekile: YAZI, YIBONE, YITHETHE

SourceText: 1Ô∏è‚É£ **KNOW IT**
text: 1Ô∏è‚É£ **YAZI**

SourceText: Know the difference between healthy and unhealthy relationships ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ùå. If you're attacked, it‚Äôs never your fault. Do what you need to stay safe and get away ‚Äîdon't worry about what others think. You are worth defending üí™. You are strong and powerful ‚ö°.
text: Wazi umahluko phakathi kobudlelwane obunempilo kunye nobungenampilo ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ùå. Ukuba uyahlaselwa, ayilotyala lakho. Yenza oko kufunekayo ukuze uhlale ukhuselekile kwaye ubaleke - ungakhathazeki malunga nokuba abanye bacinga ntoni. Kufanelekile ukuba uzikhusele üí™. Womelele kwaye unamandla ‚ö°.

SourceText: 2Ô∏è‚É£ **SEE IT**
text: 2Ô∏è‚É£ **YIBONE**

SourceText: If someone makes you or anyone else feel uncomfortable with what they say or do, it‚Äôs never okay! We all have the right to feel safe, especially at home üè†. Trust your gut. If you feel attacked by words or actions, your goal is to get away.
text: Ukuba umntu wenza ukuba wena okanye nabani na ongomnye azive engonwabanga ngento ayithethayo okanye ayenzayo, ayisoze ilunge! Sonke sinelungelo lokuziva sikhuselekile, ingakumbi ekhaya üè†. Themba imvakalelo yakho. Ukuba uziva uhlaselwa ngamazwi okanye ngezenzo, injongo yakho kukubaleka.

SourceText: 3Ô∏è‚É£ **SAY IT**
text: 3Ô∏è‚É£ **YITHETHE**

SourceText: Your voice can stop many attacks.
text: Ilizwi lakho linokunqanda uhlaselo oluninzi.

SourceText: Be clear, confident, and direct. Use your voice, body language, and eye contact. If you don't feel safe, you can do whatever it takes to get away.
text: Cacisa, zithembe, kwaye ungqale. Sebenzisa ilizwi lakho, ulwimi lomzimba, kunye nokudibana kwamehlo. Ukuba awuziva ukhuselekile, ungenza nantoni na ukuze ubaleke.

SourceText: Using your voice can look different in different situations. You could shout "No!", call for help, act strangely to confuse the attacker, or negotiate.
text: Ukusebenzisa ilizwi lakho kunokubonakala ngokwahlukileyo kwiimeko ezahlukeneyo. Unokukhwaza uthi ‚ÄúHayi!‚Äù, cela uncedo, wenze ngendlela engaqhelekanga ukubhidisa umhlaseli, okanye uthethathethwano.

SourceText: Here are some things you might say or shout to avoid a tough situation:
text: Nazi ezinye izinto onokuthi uzithethe okanye uzikhwaze ukuphepha imeko enzima:

SourceText: ‚ÄúI will call the police if you touch me again üöî.‚Äù
text: "Ndiza kufowunela amapolisa ukuba uyandibamba kwakhonaüöî."

SourceText: ‚ÄúDo not touch my bum!‚Äù üëé
text: "Musa ukubamba iimpundu zam!" üëé

SourceText: Or you might say:
text: Okanye unokuthi:

SourceText: ‚ÄúNo lift for me, thanks! Last time I got a lift, I threw up!‚Äù ü§Æ
text: ‚ÄúAndiceli kuqatyeliswa, enkosi! Ukugqibela kwam ukuqatyeliswa, ndaphalaza!‚Äù ü§Æ

SourceText: ‚ÄúI will give you my phone if you let me go.‚Äù üì±
text: "Ndiza kukunika ifowuni yam ukuba uyandiyeka ndihambe." üì±

SourceText: Think about what you would do in some of the examples we have looked at. There is no wrong answer! ‚ú®
text: Cinga ngento obuya kuyenza kweminye yemizekelo esikhe sayijonga. Akukho mpendulo iphosakeleyo! ‚ú®

SourceText: Remember, if someone hurts you, it‚Äôs never your fault. Ask someone you trust for help ü§ù. Make sure your teen knows they can tell you anything so you can find a solution together.
text: Ukuba umntu uyakonzakalisa, khumbula ukuba ayilotyala lakho. Cela uncedo kumntu omthembileyo ü§ù. Qinisekisa ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo uyazi ukuba unokukuxelela nantoni na ukuze nifumane isisombululo kunye.

SourceText: Help your teen be prepared by repeating this lesson together. To repeat this lesson you can type {PREVENT} after we finish. Can you do it today?
text: Nceda umntwana wakho ofikisayo azilungiselele ngokuphinda esi sifundo kunye. Ukuphinda esi sifundo ungacofa {PREVENT} emva kokuba sigqibile. Ungayenza namhlanje?

SourceText: That‚Äôs great! ‚ú®
text: Kwakuhle oko! ‚ú®

SourceText: This lesson is about learning how to respond to crises when they happen. ‚ùó
text: Esi sifundo simalunga nokufunda indlela yokuphendula kwiingxaki xa zisenzeka. ‚ùó

SourceText: When our teens share something that is very hard or upsetting to them, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open so that they feel supported. üíõ
text: Xa abantwana bethu abafikisayo besabelana ngento enzima kakhulu okanye ebacaphukisayo, kufuneka sikhumbule ukuhlala sizolile, simamele, kwaye sivuleleke ukuze bazive bexhaswa. üíõ

SourceText: Here is an example of supporting  your teen, even when something really bad happens.
text: Nanku umzekelo wokuxhasa umntwana wakho ofikisayo, nokuba kukho into embi kakhulu eyenzekayo.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Torho sthandwa, ubonakala ukhathazeke nyani, uyafuna ukundibalisela ukuba kwenzeke ntoni?

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: It‚Äôs my Uncle, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ he touched me.
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: Ngumalume wam, u... u... uye wandiphatha.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER} (thinking): Take a deep breath... What does my child need? She needs me to be calm and  comforting and to listen if she wants to talk.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (ecinga): Phefumla... Udinga ntoni umntwana wam? Ufuna ndizole ndithuthuzele ndize ndimamele xa efuna ukuthetha.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, I‚Äôm listening.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Yiza uhlale phantsi ecaleni kwam. Thatha ixesha lakho, ndimamele.

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: It‚Äôs true, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ made me do it! He made me have sex with him! I didn‚Äôt want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: Yinyani, u... u... undenze ukuba ndiyenze! Wandenza ndalala naye! Bendingafuni, ndiyafunga, kwaye ndide ndathi HAYI, kodwa wandixelela ukuba ndiza kuba sengxakini.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Enkosi ngokwabelana nam ngalento. Awukho sengxakini. Ayilotyala lakho eli.

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: Yesterday when you went to see your friend. He just came and that‚Äôs when it happened.
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: Izolo ngokuya ubuyokubona umhlobo wakho. Uvele wafika kwaye kungeloxesha yenzeke ngalo.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: It‚Äôs okay, I believe you my child. This is a big thing and we will find a way to get the help we need. Where could we go for help?
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Kulungile, ndiyakukholelwa mntwana wam. Yinto enkulu lena kwaye sizakufumana indlela yokufumana uncedo esiludingayo. Singayaphi ukufumana uncedo?

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: The clinic?
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: Ekliniki?

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: That is a great suggestion, {F2_DAUGHTER_17}, let‚Äôs go to the clinic. They will know what we can do to help you. Does that sound okay to you?
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Licebo elihle elo, {F2_DAUGHTER_17}, masiye ekliniki. Baya kuyazi into esinokuyenza ukuze sikuncede. Ngaba oko kuvakala kulungile kuwe?

SourceText: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: Yes‚Ä¶ Okay‚Ä¶ But will you come with me?
text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_17}**: Ewe‚Ä¶ Kulungile‚Ä¶ Kodwa ungahamba nam?

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Of course I will. And {F2_DAUGHTER_17}? Remember this is not your fault. You did nothing to deserve this. I love you. We will get through this.
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: Nakanjani ndizakwenza njalo. Kwaye {F2_DAUGHTER_17}? Khumbula ayilotyala lakho eli. Awenzanga nto ifanelwe yile nto. Ndiyakuthanda. Siza kudlula kule nto.

SourceText: Teens are spending a lot of time online. Being connected helps them stay positive and learn more! But there are also some risks and dangers. üö©
text: Abantwana abafikisayo bachitha ixesha elininzi kwi-Intanethi. Ukunxibelelana kubanceda bahlale benethemba kwaye bafunde ngakumbi! Kodwa kukwakho eminye imingcipheko kunye neengozi. üö©

SourceText: Let's see how {F1_DAUGHTER_13}'s mother helps her stay safe online.
text: Makhe sibone ukuba umama ka {F1_DAUGHTER_13} umnceda njani ukuba ahlale ekhuselekile kwi-intanethi.

SourceText: **{F1_MOTHER}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}, have you done your homework?
text: **{F1_MOTHER}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}, uwenzile umsebenzi wakho wesikolo?

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: Just a minute, I'm finishing this TikTok video.
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: Umzuzu nje, ndiyayigqibezela le vidiyo yeTikTok.

SourceText: **{F1_MOTHER}**: You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like it.
text: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Ungumdanisi obalaseleyo ngokwenene! Ndixelele isizathu sokuba ukuthande.

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: All my friends are on it. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers.
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: Bonke abahlobo bam bakuyo. Ndinee-likes ezingaphezulu kwamakhulu asithandathu kunye nabalandeli abalikhulu namashumi amabini.

SourceText: **{F1_MOTHER}**: I‚Äôm proud of how well you dance, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}. But we need to make sure you are safe on this. I know your friends look at TikTok, but with an open account there are also paedophiles who look at videos of teenagers. Paedophiles are adults who are sexually attracted to young children and teens.
text: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Ndiyazingca ngendlela odanisa kamnandi ngayo, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}. Kodwa kumele siqinisekise ukuba ukhuselekile kulento. Ndiyazi ukuba abahlobo bakho bajonga kuTikTok, kodwa nge akhawunti evulekileyo kukho nabantu abazi Paedophiles abajonga iividiyo zabantwana abafikisayo. Paedophiles ngabantu abadala abancwase ukwabelana ngesondo nabantwana abancinci okanye abafikisayo.

SourceText: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Let‚Äôs look together online at how we can keep this fun for you but also safe. Look ‚Äì you can make your account private and control who follows you. So you can accept people you know but not strangers. Can we make a rule together that you can use TikTok but with a private account? I trust you to know who to accept!
text: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Makhe sijonge kunye kwi-intanethi ukuba singayigcina isonwabisa njani kuwe lento kwakhona kodwa ikhuselekile. Jonga unokwenza i-akhawunti yakho ibe yimfihlo kwaye ulawule ukuba ngubani na okulandelayo. Ngoko ke unokwamkela abantu obaziyo kodwa hayi abantu ongabaziyo. Ingaba singawenza umthetho kunye ukuba ungasebenzisa uTikTok kodwa nge-akhawunti yabucala? Ndiyakuthemba ukuba uyazi ukuba wamkela bani!

SourceText: **{F1_MOTHER}**: I‚Äôm proud of you {F1_DAUGHTER_13}...
text: **{F1_MOTHER}**: Ndiyazingca ngawe {F1_DAUGHTER_13}...

SourceText: Set up safe online habits at home.
text: Misela imikhwa ekhuselekileyo ye-intanethi ekhaya.

SourceText: ‚≠ê Create rules with @fields.child_nickname about who they can chat with online. It is safest to only chat with people they already know. They should never share personal information in a chat room or with strangers.
text: ‚≠ê Yenza imithetho no@fields.child_nickname malunga nokuba angancokola nabani kwi-intanethi. Kukhuselekile ukuncokola kuphela nabantu asele ebazi. Akumelanga abelane ngenkcazelo yobuqu kwindawo yokuncokola okanye nabantu abangabaziyo.

SourceText: üìù Help @fields.child_nickname create strong passwords for their accounts. They should be long, not include obvious personal information like your name or birthday, and include upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols.
text: üìù Nceda u@fields.child_nickname enze amagama ayimfihlo aqinileyo kwii-akhawunti zakhe. Kufuneka zibe nde, zingaquki iinkcukacha zobuqu ezicacileyo njengegama lakho okanye usuku lwakho lokuzalwa, kwaye ziquke oonobumba abakhulu nabancinci, amanani kunye neempawu.
